Company Description:

Swiss Reinsurance America Corporation operates as a property and casualty reinsurance company in the United States. The company focuses on offering risk transfer, risk finance, and asset management services in three business groups, such as life, property/casualty, and financial services. Its services include strategic planning, financial reporting and analysis, loss reserving, and accounting; and claims services. The company also provides recommendations for expert legal, financial, and accounting issues; analysis of exposures and losses; control of environmental exposures with designated APH unit; evaluation of engineered risk; information on claims issues through an electronic discussion and research global claims platform; and specialized assistance to clients in various phases of marine insurance from risk selection through claims management. In addition, it offers capacity on both a proportional and excess of loss basis for various types of marine risks, such as tugs and barges, offshore supply vessels, fishing vessels, ferries, mega yachts and recreational marine, ship repairer's legal liability, marine operator's legal liability, marine general liability, stevedore's legal liability, and project cargo. The company was formerly known as North American Reinsurance Corporation and changed its name to Swiss Reinsurance America Corporation in May, 1995. The company was founded in 1940 and is based in Armonk, New York. Swiss Reinsurance America operates as a subsidiary of Swiss Re America Holding Corporation.

Company Description:

Kayne Anderson Capital Advisors, L.P., founded in 1984, is a leading independent alternative investment management firm focused on niche investing in upstream oil and gas companies, energy infrastructure, specialized real estate, middle market credit, growth private equity and distressed municipal opportunities. Kayne's investment philosophy is to pursue niches, with an emphasis on cash flow, where our knowledge and sourcing advantages enable us to deliver above average, risk-adjusted investment returns. Kayne manages approximately $28 billion in assets (as of 5/31/2014) for institutional investors, family offices, high net worth and retail clients and employs nearly 250 professionals in eight offices across the United States.

Industrial Solutions, Inc. is an insulation, scaffold, coatings, and general labor company that provides a variety of specialty services such as piping, erection and dismantling for industrial and commercial needs, blasting, janitorial, lawn maintenance, etc. Its clients mostly come from the petrochemical, power and utilities, refining, pulp and paper, commercial, and marine industries. Industrial Solutions aims to satisfy all of its clients' specialty contractor needs.

Main Street Connect LLC is primarily engaged in publishing newspapers, or in publishing and printing newspapers. These establishments carry on the various operations necessary for issuing newspapers, including the gathering of news and the preparation of editorials and advertisements, but may or may not perform their own printing. Commercial printing is frequently carried on in publishing and printing newspapers.

Company Description:

Visant Holding provides marketing and publishing services for the school affinity, and educational and trade publishing and packaging markets. The company operates in three segments: Scholastic, Memory Book, and Publishing and Packaging Services. The Scholastic segment produces, markets, and sells class rings, as well as various graduation products, including caps, gowns, diplomas and announcements, graduation-related accessories, and other scholastic affinity products to students and administrators in high schools, colleges, and universities through retail channel and online.

Company Description:

Informix provides database management systems for data warehousing, e-business applications, and transaction processing. Informix Corporation was originally named Relational Database Systems Inc. and was created in 1980 by Roger Sippl. The company changed its name to Informix Corporation prior to going public in 1986. The company pursued a strategy of development and acquisition in the mid 80s. The company's best known product was the Informix database. Since its acquisition by IBM in 2005, IBM Informix is one of the world's most widely used database servers, with users ranging from the world's largest corporations to startups.
